purpose: To present the analysis of customer behavior changes following the launch of a new loyalty program.
title: Department Store Retailer: Measuring Launch of Loyalty Program
supporting_facts: US retailer wanted to analyze changes in their customers’ behavior following the launch of new loyalty program.
Divided loyalty program membership into (i) early adopters, and, (ii) ‘late adopters’, and then by applying proprietary spending data and analytics.

situation.text: US retailer wanted to analyze changes in their customers’ behavior following the launch of new loyalty program

approach.text: Divided loyalty program membership into early and late adopters, assessing spending behavior differences and loyalty evolution.

text: Early enrollers tend to be established loyal customers, spending a higher-than-average SOW in both the pre- and post- enrollment periods.
Among early adopters, the SOW increases post-enrollment, suggesting that the loyalty program may help loyal customers to become even more loyal.
There is a >3x lift in SOW across loyalty program members, regardless of when they join, but it trails off 6-months post-membership.
